comments:
I have set up the web tools for the very first time

I created a new "Dynamic Web Project" (using Tomcat 5.5 as the 
application server) and almost immediately got the warning below.

As requested on the newsgroup I have created this bug report

IWAE0010E Run-time exception java.lang.NoSuchMethodError occurred during 
validation. The validator being run was XML Validator and the message 
thrown was 
org.apache.xerces.xni.XMLResourceIdentifier.getNamespace()Ljava/lang/String;.


I am running with Sun jdk1.5.0 Update 4

We'll take  a look, but in the mean time, two things would be very helpful. 
1. run java -version from a command line window and report exact identifer. 
2. try your self to see if you get same error with earlier version of jdk1.5.0
and even try a version of 1.4.2. 

This small steps will save us some time. 
Thanks very much.

Item 1 as requested 
 
$ java -version 
java version "1.5.0_04" 
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_04-b05) 
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_04-b05, mixed mode, sharing) 
 
Item 2 
 
I will try other java runtimes on Monday - when I can get some time to download 
and try them.

I'm  getting this same error consistently when parsing web.xml. Using Eclipse 3.1, WTP 0.7 on Mac OS X 
under both 1.4.2 and 1.5.0 Apple JDKs.

This appears to be a conflict with the Spindle plugin, which installs Xerces 4.0.13 as a dependency. 
Everything works fine after uninstalling Spindle. Tested under 1.4.2. and 1.5.0 JDKs. I'll file a bug report 
with the Spindle maintainer.

More details...

Error displayed is: An internal error occurred during: "Processing Dirty Regions".

Stack trace:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.xerces.xni.XMLResourceIdentifier.getNamespace()Ljava/lang/
String;

348)
at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.validation.XMLValidator$MyEntityResolver.resolveEntity
(XMLValidator.java:326)

277)

(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:752)

(XMLDocumentScannerImpl.java:950)

(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:1523)

(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:333)

at org.apache.xerces.parsers.StandardParserConfiguration.parse(StandardParserConfiguration.java:581)
at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:147)

I have the exception raised when I modifying XML file. My workaround is to update xercesImpl.jar to Xerces-Java 2.7.1 from http://www.apache.org/dist/xml/xerces-j/

(In reply to comment #5)
> I have the exception raised when I modifying XML file. My workaround is to
> update xercesImpl.jar to Xerces-Java 2.7.1 from
> http://www.apache.org/dist/xml/xerces-j/
> 
Sorry! forgot to tell that I replaced xercesImpl.jar in <JAVA_HOME>\jre\lib\endorsed\xercesImpl.jar. My JDK version is "build 1.5.0_08-b03"
